required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study in in Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy Study Comparing a New hMG Formulation (hMG-IBSA) to a Reference Product (Menopur®) in Patients Undergoing Ovarian Stimulation for in Vitro Fertilisation (IVF)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the non-inferiority study is to evaluate the clinical efficacy and the safety of two different subcutaneous hMG preparations when administered to patients undergoing controlled ovarian stimulation for IVF.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 days after treatment start

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 22 days after treatment start

secondary_outcome.measure: Embryo Quality (Percentage of Patients With at Least One Top Quality Embryo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 28 days after treatment start
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by counting the total number of embryos obtained, the number of embryos transferred, frozen and discarded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 weeks after treatment start
up to 23 days after treatment start

secondary_outcome.measure: 17-β Estradiol (E2) Serum Concentration on the Monitoring Day Before hCG Injection;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 23 days after treatment start

secondary_outcome.description: defined as the mean of the total number of implanted embryos (presence of gestational sac assessed by ultrasound) divided by the total number of transferred embryos x 100;
defined as a pregnancy showing ultrasound embryonic heart activity at 10 - 11 weeks after embryo transfer;

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Mature (Grade III Metaphase II) Oocytes Retrieved.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the stimulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio Mature/Total Number of Oocytes Retrieved.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the stimulation.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of retrieved oocytes considered to be mature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Inseminated Oocytes (IVF and ICSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the day of oocyte retrieval
secondary_outcome.description: number of oocytes that were inseminated via IVF or injected via ICSI technique.

intervention.description: Daily administration, SC, starting dose 150 IU or 225 IU depending on patient age.
Daily administration, SC, starting dose 150 IU or 225 IU depending on patient age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women undergoing ovarian stimulation for IVF with the following characteristics:
- Able and willing to sign the Patient Consent Form and adhere to the study visitation schedule
- >18 and <40 years old
- BMI between 18 and 30 kg/m2
- less than 3 previously completed IVF cycles (i.e. completed cycle = egg recovery)
- basal FSH <10 IU/L and E2 <80 pg/ml (~290 pmol/l)
- Within 12 months of the beginning of the study, uterine cavity consistent with expected normal function as assessed through transvaginal ultrasound, hysterosalpingogram, sonohysterogram or hysteroscopic examination
- Successful down-regulation performed with a standard GnRH-Agonist long protocol (Criteria for successful down-regulation: endometrial thickness < 7mm or serum E2 level <50 pg/ml (~185 pmol/l).
Exclusion Criteria:
- age <18 and >40 years
- primary ovarian failure or women known as poor responders (i.e. requiring more than 225 IU of hMG as a starting dose in previous treatment cycles or having less than 3 oocytes retrieved, or with a pre-ovulatory E2 serum concentration <500pg/ml (~1800 pmol/l))
- PCOS
- one or both ovaries inaccessible for oocyte retrieval
- ovarian cysts >10 mm
- hydrosalpinx that have not been surgically removed or ligated;
- stage 3 or 4 endometriosis
- oocyte donation
- implantation of previously frozen embryos
- patients affected by pathologies associated with any contraindication of being pregnant
- hypersensitivity to the study medication
- abnormal bleeding of undetermined origin
- uncontrolled thyroid or adrenal dysfunction
- neoplasias
- severe impairment of renal and/or hepatic function
- use of concomitant medications that might interfere with study evaluations (e.g. non-study hormonal medications, prostaglandin inhibitors, psychotropic agents)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The one-way Analysis of Variance with Least-Squares means was performed to calculate the 95% Confidence Interval of the difference between the two treatments. If the lower bound of the 95% Confidence Interval of the difference between means (hMG-IBSA minus Menopur®) was greater than -2.1, then hMG-IBSA would be considered to be not-inferior to the comparator.

outcome.title: Mean hMG Dose (Total);
outcome.time_frame: up to 22 days after treatment start

outcome.title: Embryo Quality (Percentage of Patients With at Least One Top Quality Embryo)
outcome.description: Assessed by counting the total number of embryos obtained, the number of embryos transferred, frozen and discarded.
outcome.time_frame: up to 28 days after treatment start
outcome.population: The population analysed corresponds to the patients who had at least one embryo to be analysed (i.e 120 participants in the hMG-IBSA group and 123 in the Menopur group). Of this, 119 in the hMG-IBSA group and 121 in the Menopur group underwent embryo transfer.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
